thread.title: Carson Newsome takes charge as Waukegan pulls away to beat Warren
thread.title_full: Carson Newsome takes charge as Waukegan pulls away to beat Warren

author: LaMond Pope
title: Carson Newsome takes charge as Waukegan pulls away to beat Warren
text:
Carson Newsome takes charge as Waukegan pulls away to beat Warren Carson Newsome takes charge as Waukegan pulls away to beat Warren Mark Ukena / Lake County News-Sun Waukegan's Carson Newsome goes up for a layup after getting around Warren's Ian Schilling on Tuesday. Waukegan's Carson Newsome goes up for a layup after getting around Warren's Ian Schilling on Tuesday. (Mark Ukena / Lake County News-Sun) 
Waukegan's lead was down to one point in the third quarter of Tuesday's game at Warren. 
That's when senior Carson Newsome took over for the Bulldogs. 
First, the 6-foot-5 guard scored inside. Then he made a 3-pointer. The two baskets sparked Waukegan on the way to the 81-70 North Suburban victory. 
Waukegan closed the third quarter on a 12-1 run to take control of the game. 
"We needed this one after the hard Zion loss (on Friday)," Newsome said. "Everything hasn't been flowing right, but we're bouncing back now." 
Bryant Brown scored 24 points and DeShawn Davidson scored 22 for the Bulldogs (15-8, 7-4). Newsome finished with 21 points and Ja'Dyn Brown scored 10 points. 
"That was probably the best game the starting lineup had together," Bryant Brown said. 
Jayson Dorsey and Branden Ellis scored 18 points for Warren (12-12, 5-7). Juwan Perry had 17 points and Declan O'Connor scored 10 for the Blue Devils. 
"Waukegan just outplayed us," Warren coach Jon Jasnoch said. "Right from the opening. They were playing at another speed than we were." 
Davidson, Newsome and Bryant Brown scored all the points during a 14-0 run to begin the game. 
Davidson started the scoring with a jumper. Newsome followed with a 3-pointer. Davidson then made a 3-pointer to make it 8-0. Layups by Bryant Brown and Davidson stretched the lead to 12-0. Bryant Brown finished the run, scoring on a layup off a steal. 
Warren scored its first points with a 3-pointer by Dorsey with 4:09 left in the first quarter. Waukegan led 22-9 at the end of the first quarter. 
The Bulldogs used an 8-2 run early in the second quarter to stretch its lead to 30-16. Davidson scored four of the points in the run. 
Warren went on a 10-2 run late in the half to get back in the game. Ellis started the run with a 3-pointer. He made a second 3-pointer to get Warren within 38-29. Baskets by Dorsey and Perry got Warren within 38-33 with 48 seconds left in the second quarter. 
Davidson made a 3-pointer at the buzzer to give Waukegan a 41-33 lead at halftime. 
Warren went on a 9-0 run to get within one point in the third quarter. Dorsey made a 3-pointer to cut Waukegan's lead to 45-44 with 5:09 remaining in the third quarter. 
Waukegan led 49-48 when Newsome took over. He scored Waukegan's first eight points during the 12-1 run to end the quarter. 
Warren got within 67-62 halfway through the fourth quarter. But Waukegan used a 10-3 run to put the game away. 
"It showed that we could overcome a little adversity," Bryant Brown said.
